reign:
统治，主宰 
to rule as a king, queen, emperor, etc.

统治，统治时期 
the period of time during which a king, queen, emperor, etc., is ruler of a country
ceaseless:
持续的，不停的 
seeming to never stop; continuous or constant
legion:
古罗马军团，兵团 
a unit of the Roman army consisting of 3, 000 to 6, 000 soldiers

众多，大量，大批 
a vast host, multitude, or number of people or things
demote:
使降级，使降职，使降低地位 
to change the rank or position of (someone) to a lower or less important one
endearing:
惹人喜爱的 
inspiring love or affection
pseudonym:
假名；笔名 
a name that someone (such as a writer) uses instead of his or her real name gaiety n.快乐，兴高采烈 
happiness and excitement
yoke:
轭； 尤指 牛轭 
a long piece of wood that is fastened across the necks of two animals, especially oxen, so 
that they can pull heavy loads

奴役；束缚；枷锁；羁绊 
harsh treatment or something that restricts your freedom and makes your life very difficult 
to bear
renounce:
宣布放弃，抛弃 信仰或行为方式 
to say especially in a formal or official way that you will no longer have or accept 
(something); to formally give up (something)
sporadic:
零星的，间断发生的 
happening often but not regularly; not constant or steady
template:
模板，样板 
a shape cut out of a hard material, used as a model for producing exactly the same shape 
many times in another material; a thing that is used as a model for producing other similar examples 
1
archaic:
古时的，古代的 
of or relating to ancient times

陈旧的，已不通用的 
old and no longer useful bemoan v.哀叹 
to complain or express sadness about something
virtuous:
正直的 
morally good; having or showing virtue
furnish:
提供 
to supply or give (something) to someone or something
transient:
短暂的 
lasting for only a short time; temporary

临时旅客；流动短工；暂居者 
someone who lives only temporarily in a place
parody:
滑稽的模仿作品 
a piece of writing, music, etc., that imitates the style of someone or something else in an 
amusing way

滑稽地模仿，拙劣地模仿 
to imitate (someone or something) in an amusing way
tenant:
承租人；租户；房客 
a person, business, group, etc., that pays to use another person's property
neurotic:
神经机能病的；神经官能症的 
caused by or suffering from neurosis

神经质的；神经过敏的 
not behaving in a reasonable, calm way, because you are worried about something
outlandish:
古怪的 
very strange or unusual; extremely different from what is normal or expected
upheaval:
剧变 
a major change or period of change that causes a lot of conflict, confusion, anger, etc.
halt:
阻止 
to stop (something or someone) from moving or continuing
brooding:
幽怨的；忧思的；森然的；险恶的 
sad and mysterious or threatening 
2
quadruple:
使 成为四倍 
to cause (something) to become four times bigger

四部分组成的 
having four parts or including four people or things
gadget:
小器具；小装置 
a small tool or device that does something useful
venturesome:
冒险的 
willing to take risks; daring
imperative:
专横的 
expressing a command in a forceful and confident way
canon:
标准 
an accepted rule or guide about how people should behave or about how something should 
be done
glimmer:
微光 
a weak, unsteady light

闪烁微光 
to shine in a weak, faint, or unsteady way
cherish:
珍爱 
to feel or show great love for (someone or something)
contrition:
悔恨，悔罪 
the state of feeling sorry for bad behavior; the state of being contrite
optimal:
最理想的，最佳的 
better, best, maximum; optimum
vent:
出口，通风口 
an opening through which air, steam, smoke, liquid, etc., can go into or out of a room, 
machine, or container

感情的发泄 
an opportunity or a way to express a strong emotion that you have not openly shown
rally:
集会 
a public meeting to support or oppose someone or something

聚集，集合 
to meet publicly to support or oppose something;to come together for a rally 
3
glare:
怒目而视 
to look at somebody/something in an angry way

发出刺眼的光 
to shine with a very bright unpleasant light

刺眼的光 
a very bright, unpleasant light

长久的怒视，瞪眼 
a long, angry look
riot:
暴乱 
a situation in which a large group of people behave in a violent and uncontrolled way

闹事 
to behave in a violent and uncontrolled way
grudge:
积怨，怀恨 
a strong feeling of anger toward someone that lasts for a long time
endow:
资助 
to give a large amount of money to a school, hospital, etc., in order to pay for the creation 
or continuing support of (something)

赋予 
to freely or naturally provide (someone or something) with something
despondent:
沮丧的 
feeling or showing extreme discouragement, dejection, or depression
disoriented:
分不清方向或目标的 
to make (someone) lost or confused
populace:
平民，百姓，民众 
the people who live in a country or area
recruit:
招募 
to find suitable people and get them to join a company, an organization, the armed forces, 
etc.

新成员 
a person who has recently joined a company, organization, etc.
errant:
犯错误的；行为不当的；出格的 
doing something that is wrong; not behaving in an acceptable way
desultory:
漫无目的的 
not having a plan or purpose
doctrinaire:
教条主义的 
used to describe a person who has very strong beliefs about what should be done and will 
not change them or accept other people's opinions 
4
uptick:
小幅增加 
a small increase
stab:
刺，戳，捅 
to wound (someone or something) with a pointed weapon (such as a knife)
rigor:
严格 
the quality or state of being very exact, careful, or strict
entangle:
纠缠一起 
to wrap or twist together
hypersensitive:
精神过敏的，易受伤的 
having feelings that are very easily hurt
swindle:
欺诈，诈骗 
to take money or property from (someone) by using lies or tricks
baffle:
使困惑；把 难住 
to confuse (someone) completely

阻碍，阻止 
to hinder or prevent (the efforts, plans, or desires) of

控制声、光、液体等流动的隔板，挡板，反射板 
a screen used to control or prevent the flow of sound, light or liquid
decorous:
端庄得体的 
correct and polite in a particular situation
pinnacle:
顶峰，极点； 
the best or most important part of something; the point of greatest success or achievement

高峰 
a high mountain top
servile:
奴性的，恭顺的 
very obedient and trying too hard to please someone
tentative:
试探性的，不确定的 
not done with confidence; uncertain and hesitant
synchronize:
使 同步； 使 同速进行 
to cause (things) to agree in time or to make (things) happen at the same time and speed
strained:
紧张的 
feeling or showing the effect of too much work, use, effort, etc. 
5
wade:
蹚，涉水 
to walk through water
expire:
到期；失效 
to end; to no longer be valid after a period of time
binary:
二进制的用 和 记数 
using only 0 and 1 as a system of numbers

二元的；由两部份组成的；仅基于两个数字的 
consisting of two parts; based on only two numbers
subservient:
次要的 
less important than something or someone else

低声下气的 
very willing or too willing to obey someone else
wilt:
使 枯萎，凋谢，蔫 
(of a plant, leaf, or flower) become limp through heat, loss of water, or disease; droop

变得委靡不振；发蔫；变得又累又乏；失去自信 
to become weak or tired or less confident
maneuver:
策略 
an action taken to gain a tactical end

操纵，控制，耍花招 
to do something in an effort to get an advantage, get out of a difficult situation
ratify:
批准，认可 
to make (a treaty, agreement, etc.) official by signing it or voting for it
interdisciplinary:
跨学科的 
involving two or more academic, scientific, or artistic areas of knowledge; involving two or 
more disciplines
reclusive:
隐居的 
a person who lives alone and avoids other people
pry:
撬开，撬动 
to raise, move, or open (something) with a tool

刺探，探查别人的隐私 
to try to find out about other people's private lives
dormant:
休眠的 
not doing anything at this time
underhanded:
秘密的；狡诈的；欺诈的 
done in a secret and dishonest way; intended to deceive or trick someone 
6
myopic:
近视的 
nearsighted, suffering from myopia

目光短浅的 
lacking insight and forethought
underscore: a line drawn under a word or line especially for emphasis or to indicate intent to italicize
acoustical:
听觉的 
of or relating to sound or to the sense of hearing
browse:
浏览 
to look at many things in a store, in a newspaper, etc., to see if there is something 
interesting or worth buying

吃草 
to eat grass, plants, etc.
flippant:
轻率的 
lacking proper respect or seriousness
downcast:
情绪低落的 
not happy, confident, or hopeful

因伤心或尴尬而向下看的 
looking downward
sunder:
尤指强制地分开，使分离，割裂 
to split or break something/somebody apart, especially by force
abolish:
废除，废止 法律、制度、习俗等 
to officially end a law, a system or an institution
zigzag:
之字形 
a line that has a series of short, sharp turns or angles

曲折前行 
to move along a path that has a series of short, sharp turns or angles
unsparing:
不宽恕的，不留情的 
not caring about people's feelings
deplore:
公开谴责，强烈反对 
to strongly disapprove of something and criticize it, especially publicly
behold:
注视 
to look at (something); to see (something)
